story.title: How does the Habit Flywheel work?
story.subtitle: A repeatable system that links desire, habits, and the rewards you care about.

items.title: Validate the reward first
items.description: Treat every reward as a hypothesis. Run challenges and track check-ins to see if it truly motivates you before investing time and money.

items.title: Bind habits to the reward
items.description: Break the reward into daily habits and assign energy values so every action earns visible progress toward the payoff.

steps.title: Name the desire
steps.description: Capture the reward you crave and treat it as a demand to be validated.

steps.title: Design a challenge
steps.description: Time-box a challenge around it. Completion data tells you whether the reward is truly meaningful.

steps.title: Bind habits
steps.description: Split the challenge into repeatable habits, each with an energy value you earn once finished.

steps.title: Redeem the payoff
steps.description: When energy reaches the threshold, claim the reward and reinforce the loop.

narrative.title: Rooted in lived experience
paragraphs: The author struggled with study plans and productivity systems that never answered whether the reward was worth the effort.
The habit flywheel reframes the process as a loop of desire, validation, execution, and reinforcement so every action maps to a tangible benefit.
Use it as a personal operating system where rewards, habits, and energy live in the same dashboard.
narrative.quote: Only validated rewards deserve the habits you invest in
